-1.

I am not under impression that the src tree is (yet) polluted with unit tests. Though, it would be 
great to be in that position.  At this point, I think that we should keep them as is (in your face) 
as a constant reminder that unit tests should/must be written.

i.


> In Heritrix, unit tests sit beside the classes tested though the common 
> practise is to keep tests apart from the runtime src, in a directory of 
> tests only.  The original rationale for putting tests beside the classes 
> tested was to avoid having to look in two places for code and as a 
> constant in-the-developers'-face reminder that tests need to be written.
> 
> Recently Christian Kohlschï¿½tter proposed Heritrix do as other projects 
> do and move unit tests to their own directory.  In the main Christian 
> argues a src tree polluted by tests is tough to grok and that as tests 
> proliferate and become more involved -- if we start adding mock objects 
> and test data -- apprehension of Heritrix workings will get harder with 
> time.  His argument in full can be viewed here: 
> http://sourceforge.net/tracker/index.php?func=detail&aid=1187976&group_id=73833&atid=539102.
> 
> What do others think?
> 
> (How about an apache-like +1 if you agree that tests should be moved, -1 
> if you disagree, and 0 if neutral.  Let majority carry the motion, 
> unless a minority puts up a good fight).
> 
> Yours,
> St.Ack
